definition: to see the light again (idiom); delivered from oppression
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview
abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan

sentences.english: If you attack the Pentagon, you might want to hide.
sentences.chinese: 如果你襲擊了五角大樓，你就別想重見天日。

sentences.english: An immigration amnesty has enabled many illegal residents in the U.
sentences.chinese: 移民大赦使得部分非法在美居留的人得以重見天日。

sentences.english: A long-buried side of early Christianity is re-emerging.
sentences.chinese: 如今早期基督教被掩藏已久的那一面正在重見天日。

sentences.english: So a lot of these things were rediscovered.
sentences.chinese: 這樣一大批手稿得以重見天日。

sentences.english: I know inside of you there's a nice girl that's just dying to come out.
sentences.chinese: 我知道你內心的那個好女孩快要重見天日了。

sentences.english: The eyes of the blind shall see the day and the ears of the deaf shall be opened.
sentences.chinese: 盲人之眼必重見天日，聾人之耳必重聞世音。

sentences.english: Museum basements are stacked full of objects which never see the light of day.
sentences.chinese: 博物館的地下室裏堆滿了永遠不會重見天日的物件。

definition: sb who sacrifices himself/sacrificial victim/sb who is expendable
to vanish without trace (idiom)/to lie low
lit. to return the jade annulus to Zhao (idiom); fig. to return something intact to its rightful owner
tossed about by the wind and rain (idiom)/(of a situation) unstable
lit. the salted fish turns over (idiom)/fig. to experience a reversal of fortune
fire of war everywhere (idiom); enveloped in the flames of war
to open a law court/to set up a mourning hall
to shut down/to terminate/to cancel/to go out of business
